memberdef.definition: typedef unsigned long(Landscape::* Landscape::fptr) (const double &x, const double &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double &dCurrentGen)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const double &x, const double &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double &dCurrentGen)
memberdef.name: fptr

briefdescription.para: The default constructor.
Gets the maximum habitat value from any map.

simplesect.para: the maximum habitat value

briefdescription.para: Returns if the simulation is using historical maps.

simplesect.para: true if using historical maps

briefdescription.para: Sets the dimensions of the grid, the area where the species are initially sampled from. This function must be run before any of the calc map functions to allow for the correct deme allocation.

parameterdescription.para: the SimParameters object containing the map variables to import

briefdescription.para: Checks that the map files exist (or are none/null).

simplesect.para: true if all the paths exist in configs

briefdescription.para: Imports the fine map object from file and calculates the correct values at each point. Without a map to input, the fine map will simply be a matrix of 1s.

Imports the historical fine map object from file and calculates the correct values at each point. Without a map to input, the historical fine map will simply be a matrix of 1s. This has the potential to be changed easily in future versions.

Imports the coarse map object from file and calculates the correct values at each point. Without a map to input, the coarse map will simply be a matrix of 1s. This has the potential to be changed easily in future versions.

Imports the historical coarse map object from file and calculates the correct values at each point. Without a map to input, the historical coarse map will simply be a matrix of 1s. This has the potential to be changed easily in future versions.
Sets the time variables.

parameterdescription.para: the time (in generations) since a historical habitat state was achieved.

the rate of transform of the habitat up until the historical time. A value of 0.2 would mean 20% of the change occurs linearlly up until the historical time and the remaining 80% occurs in a jump to the historical state.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the offset and extremeties of the fine map.

detaileddescription.para: Note that setting dispersal_relative_cost to a value other than 1 can massively increase simulation time.

briefdescription.para: Checks that all dimensions for all maps are zero.

detaileddescription.para: If this is true, then it means we can calculate actual offsets and dimensions from the maps, otherwise the values from the parameters will be used.

simplesect.para: true if all map offsets are zero

briefdescription.para: Calculates the offsets from the map files directly.

detaileddescription.para: Assumes that all required maps have been imported.

briefdescription.para: Uses the inputted parameters to set the offsets for the map files.

Checks that the map file sizes are correct and that each value on the fragmented maps is less than the historical maps. This should be disabled in simulations where habitat sizes are expected to shrink as well as grow.
Checks if an update needs to be performed to the map configuration, and if it does, performs the update.

parameterdescription.para: the current generation timer

simplesect.para: true if the map has been updated

briefdescription.para: Updates the historical map configuration.
Resets the historical variables to recalculate historical maps.
Gets the historical boolean.

simplesect.para: the historical map state.

briefdescription.para: Sets the historical state of the system.

parameterdescription.para: the historical state.

briefdescription.para: Get the historical map time.

simplesect.para: double the historical map time

briefdescription.para: Checks if the historical state has been reached.

detaileddescription.para:
If there are no historical maps, this function will do nothing.
generation
the time to check at.

briefdescription.para: Sets the landscape functions to either infinite or finite.

parameterdescription.para: a string of either closed, infinite, tiled_fine or tiled_coarse, corresponding to the relevant landscape type.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double &x, const double &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double &current_generation)
memberdef.name: getVal

briefdescription.para: Gets the value at a particular coordinate from the correct map. Takes in to account temporal and spatial referencing. This version involves a call to the function pointer, *getValFunc, so that the correct call to either getValFinite() or getValInfinite is made.

parameterdescription.para: the x position on the grid.
the y position on the grid.
the number of wraps in the x dimension..
the number of wraps in the y dimension..
the current generation time.

simplesect.para: the value on the correct map at the correct space.

briefdescription.para: Gets the value from the coarse maps, including linear interpolating between the historical and present maps.

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate
the y coordinate
the current generation timer

simplesect.para: the value of the map at the given coordinates and time

briefdescription.para: Gets the value from the fine maps, including linear interpolating between the historical and present maps.

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate
the y coordinate
the current generation timer

simplesect.para: the value of the map at the given coordinates and time

memberdef.argsstring: (const double &x, const double &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double &current_generation)

the y position on the grid.
the number of wraps in the x dimension..
the number of wraps in the y dimension..
the current generation time.

parameterdescription.para: the x position on the grid.
the y position on the grid.
the number of wraps in the x dimension..
the number of wraps in the y dimension..
the current generation time.

simplesect.para: the value on the correct map at the correct space.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double &x, const double &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double &current_generation)
memberdef.name: getValCoarseTiled

briefdescription.para: Gets the value at a particular coordinate from the correct map. Takes in to account temporal and spatial referencing. This version assumes an infinite landscape of tiled coarse maps.

parameterdescription.para: the x position on the grid.
the y position on the grid.
the number of wraps in the x dimension..
the number of wraps in the y dimension..
the current generation time.

simplesect.para: the value on the correct map at the correct space.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double &x, const double &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double &current_generation)
memberdef.name: getValFineTiled

briefdescription.para: Gets the value at a particular coordinate from the correct map. Takes in to account temporal and spatial referencing. This version assumes an infinite landscape of tiled fine maps.

parameterdescription.para: the x position on the grid.
the y position on the grid.
the number of wraps in the x dimension..
the number of wraps in the y dimension..
the current generation time.

simplesect.para: the value on the correct map at the correct space.

briefdescription.para: Gets the x position on the fine map, given an x and x wrapping.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that this function will not check if the value is actually within bounds of the fine map, and an error will likely be thrown by the matrix referencing if this is the case.
x
the x coordinate on the sample mask
xwrap
the x wrapping of the sample mask.
the x location on the fine map

briefdescription.para: Gets the y position on the fine map, given a y and y wrapping.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that this function will not check if the value is actually within bounds of the fine map, and an error will likely be thrown by the matrix referencing if this is the case.
y
the y coordinate on the sample mask
ywrap
the y wrapping of the sample mask.
the y location on the fine map

briefdescription.para: Converts the fine map coordinates to the sample grid coordinates. Main conversion is in a call to convertCoordinates, but also makes sure the returned types are long integers.

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate to modify
the x wrapping to modify
the y coordinate to modify
the y wrapping to modify

briefdescription.para: Counts the number of spaces available in the initial species space. Requires the samplemask to check the sampling area.

parameterdescription.para: the sample proportion (from 0 to 1).
the DataMask object to sample from.

simplesect.para: the total number of individuals predicted to initially exist on the map.

briefdescription.para: Gets the mapvars object pointer for referencing simulation parameters.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double &x, const double &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double generation)
memberdef.name: checkMap

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the point is habitat or non-habitat.

the y position on the grid.
the number of wraps in the x dimension.
the number of wraps in the y dimension.
the current generation time.

simplesect.para: a boolean of whether the map is habitat or non-habitat.

briefdescription.para: Checks that the point supplied is within map limits. If the map is inifite, returns true.

parameterdescription.para: the x position
the y position
the number of wraps in the x dimension
the number of wraps in the y dimension

true if the point is within the map limits

briefdescription.para: Fixes the coordinates to be correctly within the original grid, altering the xwrap and ywrap consequently.

parameterdescription.para: the x position.
the y position.
the number of wraps in the x dimension.
the number of wraps in the y dimension.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double &dist, const double &angle, long &startx, long &starty, long &startxwrap, long &startywrap, bool &disp_comp, const double &generation)
memberdef.name: runDispersal

briefdescription.para: The function that actually performs the dispersal. It is included here for easier programming and efficiency as the function doesn't need to perform all the checks until the edge of the fine grid.

parameterdescription.para: the distance travelled (or "distance energy" if dispersal_relative_cost is not 1).
the angle of movement.
the start x position.
the start y position.
the start number of wraps in the x dimension.
the start number of wraps in the y dimension.
a boolean of whether the dispersal was complete or not. This value is returned false if dispersal is to habitat, false otherwise.
the time in generations since the start of the simulation.

simplesect.para: the density value at the end dispersal point

memberdef.argsstring: (const long &start_x, const long &start_y, const long &start_x_wrap, const long &start_y_wrap, const double &generation)
memberdef.name: distanceToNearestHabitat

briefdescription.para: Calculates the distance from the start position to the nearest habitat cell.

parameterdescription.para: the start x coordinate
the start y coordinate
the starting x wrapping
the starting y wrapping
the generation timer

simplesect.para: the distance from the start position to the nearest habitat cell

briefdescription.para: Prints some selected Map variables to the terminal.

simplesect.para: the string containing the map variables to print

briefdescription.para: Wipes the map of all variables. Only really useful for testing purposes.
Recalculates the habitat map maximum by checking the maximums for each of the relevant map files (fine, coarse and historicals).
Operator for outputting the Map object variables to an output stream. This is used for storing the Map object to file.

parameterdescription.para: the output stream.
the Map object to output.

simplesect.para: the output stream.

briefdescription.para: Operator for inputting the Map object variables from an input stream. This is used for reading the Map object from file.

parameterdescription.para: the input stream.
the Map object to input to.

simplesect.para: the input stream.

briefdescription.para: Contains all maps and provides the functions for accessing a grid cell in the correct temporal and spacial location.

detaileddescription.para: The function runDispersal() also provides the move routine, provided two alternative methods for moving individuals. Contains routines for easy setting up and switching between the different coordinate systems required. Set the map parameters with setDims(), import the map files with calcFineMap(), calcCoarseMap() etc, then set up the landscape type using setLandscape() and sethistorical(). Usage is then by runDispersal() for running a dispersal kernel on the landscape, and then getVal() to obtain the density at the desired coordinates. All coordinates should be given in reference to the simulation grid, and offsets for the fine and coarse map are calculated automatically.
